result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew C Koehler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution is to be paid joint/several with the co-actor to Derzion Coins and to be paid in full by 07-15-2016.
Court costs are to be paid in full by 08-03-2016.

Straight Time.
Apply 4 days sentence credit.
TIME SERVED.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Andrew C Koehler in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  
Jury Trial Cancelled.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Defendant's parents presented statements to the court.



Court orders the following:
5 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
4 Days Credit.
Time Served.

Restitution:  $62.16 Joint/Several with co-actor to be paid to Derzion Coins (to be paid before costs/fines) to be paid in full by:  07/15/16.
Costs:  $243 to be paid in full by: 08/03/16
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
Alternate:  4 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
